comment: I had Dr. Lawson my semester in college. At first I thought she was the worst because I just didn't like or understand chemistry, but Dr. Lawson is really smart and she wants you to understand. Duh, you have to study. The lowest exam is dropped and the final is curved. She is by far my favorite professor. Shes funny, sarcastic, and pretty.

I do not recommend Dr. Lawson for lab. She tends to be more social than helpful, and if you're truly struggling, she will give sarcastic feedback. When I went to her office hours, she would make it seem like I was an inconvenience if I didn't know the material already. Do not take her for lab.

Dr Lawson was a good chem professor. I hate chemistry and still do but I passed so. She is pretty clear in her teaching and the tests are straight forward. Plus I thought she was hot, even while she was pregnant.

I felt as if I had to do depend on YouTube a lot. Very quick to answer questions. Depends mainly on the PowerPoints, not much homework at all just a good amount of studying, pretty funny, around 15-20 question tests, knows what she's talking about. Good teacher but didn't work the best for me personally. Make sure to be active. Final was difficult!

Do not take her class. Her lectures are impossible to understand and she makes no sense. Everything I learned from her class I learned from the book. It seemed like she was just trying to show off how much she knew in class. Got frustrated when people did not understand her and was annoyed if you went into her office to ask for help.

I was nervous about this course, but Dr. Lawson is a really good teacher, I had her for lab too and I recommend her for both. While she doesn't have much time to teach in the 50 min lecture she is there for you outside of class if you need it.  The tests were pretty easy if you study and if you pay attention in class everything is pretty clear cut.

Take Dr. Lawson for Gen Chem!  I didn't like chem until I took her class. Dr. Lawson is funnily sarcastic making the environment fun and also knows her material very well. I originally found it hard to keep up and understand, but I soon caught on. Make sure you do you part with studying and preparing. Go to her office hours! She's also very pretty.
Very easy going lab. Lenient grader. Take her!

Do NOT take her!!! She isn't helpful at all. Very harsh on grading. She knows the material but isn't so great in explaining to students. Plus she gives you less time during the exam. Unless your a self leaner and enjoy reading the entire book, then don't take her!

I did not like Dr. Lawson in lab. She does not help you at all during the class. She just semi explains what we are doing then sits in the back and talks to the assistant the ENTIRE time. EVERY DAY. The she will just tell you to come to her office hours for help! I struggled completing almost every write up. Also, not very forgiving when grading.

This was the hardest class ever she knows her material i just don't think she knows how to pass her knowledge to others Most of the time it felt like we were reviewing in the class and she assumes that everyone gets it or knows the material If i had a choice i would have dropped her along time ago

not really that fun a class. She is an okay professor. I hate the way she uses the class before ane xam. barely has anytime for review. she can't manage time during class. It was an alright class but she wasn't a great professor.
Interesting and good looking enough to get you into class. She knows her stuff, but she can be a bit condescending. Easy A if you show up and do the classwork. I'd take her again.
She plays favorites and is very condescending. Also unwilling to help or even speak to some of her students.

Best professor I've had! Do all prefecture quizzes, go to class, and do suggested problems and it should be an easy pass! Her tests are pretty straight forward but it is Chemistry so studying is a must. She drops lowest test grade and curves at the end of the course. She doesn't announce in class assignments so go! She does announce quizzes
Dr.Lawson is great. I had her for an 8 AM and she made it fun to be there. She is very good at explaining difficult concepts and has a wonderful sense of humor. Take her!
The best professor ever! She is always ready to help and is very clear about what she expects you to know in exams.

Dr. Lawson is phenomenal. She was born to teach and is always very approachable if you have questions. She encourages you to attend office hours if you need help and you get a lot out of doing that. She is by far the best Chemistry professor I have ever met and this is coming from someone who fails horribly at Chemistry.

She provides students with plenty of easy quizzes and in-class assignments to boost their grades along with relatively easy tests for the subject matter. Do the practice problems, attend class, and complete the review sheets and it should be an easy A! You are in college, so working for a grade is a given. You must understand that!

She makes chemistry super simple. Of course you have to put in a lot of your own effort, but this is college & by this point you should know what's expected. Her eagerness to help is a drastic understatement, she loves watching her students learn. 4 tests with lowest dropped, ACS final, quizzes that help you, review sheets, practice exams

I would recommend her class for chem 2. She makes it clear through lectures, recommended problems, and reviews what she expects you to know for exams. Doing all of those are very helpful! Chem has never been my thing and this isnt a bad class in my opinion.

HW for every chapter that we cover, 4 test (drops lowest), pop quizzes and final. shes really nice and wants you to do your best and participate in class. Do the practice exams to do good on the test. Attendance not mandatory. Chemistry is not easy and you have to give a effort to do good in this class.

Excellent professor teaching somewhat difficult material. Office hours & SI available to clear up any confusing material. There were 4 exams plus the ACS final. Just pay attention, engage yourself in class, understand the practice exams and you will do fine. The practice exams only benefit you if you understand the concepts behind the questions.

TAKE HER. 4 exams, lowest grade dropped. Tons of opportunities to make up class assignments' points. Study for final!! You will be fine, she makes chemistry easy to understand logically. Witty. I took an 8 am and still wanted to go to every class.

She is an amazing teacher. She explains the concepts very well and really cares about her students. She is funny and interactive. She uses Celly so that students can ask questions without having to raise their hand in such a big class. I honestly loved her class and would take her for every chemistry if i wasn't transferring. Definitely take her.

This class was the most difficult class I have ever been forced to take.Dr. Lawson breezes through concepts and just assumes that everyone understands. I attended every class, did every worksheet, went to SI and still finished with a terrible grade. If at all possible refrain from this class unless you are a natural at chemistry.

Without a doubt this is a hard class. Dr. Lawson is a great professor. She gives MANY opportunities to earn points. Go to class and go to office hours. Dr.Lawson really wants her students to do well and she will make every effort to help you.

Good professor! The class is difficult and sometimes she speeds through material that needs a bit more explanation. She is quite sarcastic in a funny way but sometimes I think it keeps people from speaking up as she can make them feel stupid unknowingly. Easy grader. Wants her students to do well. I am taking her for chem 1212 next semester.

Labs are pretty boring. She's kinda sarcastic and thinks my class is rather dumb (we are), but she's a good teacher. Simple class if you just show up and follow the directions. She assigns you lab partners.

She is a great teacher. Definitely take her if you get the chance. She is very clear and great at explaining the concepts. She does give random assignments in class so go to class. She is funny and makes class interesting though. I enjoyed going and it was an 8am.

I had Prof. Lawson for lab and I made a high B with a good deal of effort. She is very clear on how she wants your lab and she is not a strict grader, but she is not the most approachable person. Go to every lab ans she will give you extra points to your grade. She is very understanding about missed assignments and is willing to help you if she can

Prof. Lawson is a super nice teacher. Always willing to help. She wants her students to succeed. I made a B in her class, but that came with effort! Buy the textbook. It helped a lot during the semester. Attend class, there are class assignments that add up in points. Overall, I would recommend her, but expect to work for your grade.
Professor Lawson is awesome! She can be humorously sarcastic, but she is incredibly helpful and presents concepts in a very clear manner.

Dr. Lawson has the upmost interest in what she does. She was a very quirky, funny, young teacher and I enjoyed her class. She offered as much help as possible and went over the material thoroughly as possible. It is a college chem class after all, you should expect to have to work for it.

This teacher is nice, BUT, flies through the material and offers  little guidance. There were no study guides, and no reviews for any test and only a small review for our final. She tries hard, but just because you are an expert  in your field DOES NOT MEAN YOU CAN TEACH IT! Find someone you will help you grasp the concept before moving on.

Great professor. Does a great job of covering a vast amount of material in one semester. Moves fast but is patient and you can tell she really has a desire for her students to not only get a good grade, but to comprehend the material as well. Tests are fair and no sweat if you prepare well. Highly recommended.

I really enjoyed taking her class. Be sure to read the book and answer all questions in the back. I have an 'A' in the class, but I have studied a lot this semester. She drops the lowest test which helps your average a lot! I would recommend her to anyone taking chemistry for the first time. She is very nice and wants her students to do well.

Very knowledgable and approachable, however I felt  for lecture she goes a bit TOO FAST.  I agree with a previous poster, she knows her material so well, at times she does look at the class like "how come you guys don't get it"...  I had her for lecture and lab.  She was better in Lab in my opinion.  She will help you to succeed though.
for LAB: She's not strict at all in the lab but make sure to not be late to class. She doesnt get in your way during lab but if you need assistance she's gladly there for you. I recommend her! :)

Seems standoffish at first but if you ask questions she is very willing to help.  Her lectures are pretty clear.  Tests are OK.  Practice the suggested book problems and do the practice test and you should be fine. Try to attend all classes since she does pop quizzes (not a lot of them) and in-class assignments.Gives you more opportunity to do well
She is so sweet. She doesn't mind coming over to you to help you when you need it. I didn't take her for lecture but I know people who did and they all had good things to say about her. :-)

She's a good teacher but I feel like she's so smart that she can't understand why the student doesn't understand the material. She offers office hours for one-on-one time and post a practice exam before each test which is helpful.

Great teacher! Knows what she's talking about! Lectures are very helpful! She doesn't check attendance but try not to miss class because chemistry is a hard subject and you can fall behind.READ READ READ the assigned chapters and do ALL of the assigned problems in the back of the chapters. She gives you a practice test which helps as well. Awesome!

Nice teacher.  Gives 4 test with the lowest score dropped and a final.  Discussion board posts are easy points and pop quizzes are challenging if you haven't practiced the material from the class before. I'd recommend her for the first chemistry.
